definition: to turn to (sth else)/to switch to
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: Mimi completely defused after listen to hypocrisy, turn to Lou issa says congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 咪咪听后怒气全消，转而假意向卢伊萨表示恭喜。

sentences.english: As Soviets you should skip Twinblades for harassment and instead go for Kirovs.
sentences.chinese: 作为苏军，你应该跳过双刃骚扰的步骤转而造基洛夫。

sentences.english: John turned up for the ten-mile walk equipped for something more like an assault on Everest.
sentences.chinese: 约翰转而开始了十英里的行军，全副武装。

sentences.english: Back in America, she became a recluse and wrote a splendid memoir
sentences.chinese: 回到美国后，她开始渐渐退出演艺圈，转而写回忆录。

sentences.english: We diverted our funds to paying for college.
sentences.chinese: 我们把我们的资金转而为学院付款。

sentences.english: Banks are reducing their dependence on wholesale funding and increasing their reliance on "stickier" deposits.
sentences.chinese: 银行正减少对批发融资的依赖，转而依靠粘性存款。

sentences.english: So he went instead to Scotland and there founded our clan.
sentences.chinese: 所以他转而来到了苏格兰，创立了我们氏族。

sentences.english: Instead of using it to grow, the bacteria breatheit out as carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 细菌难以利用其生长，转而将其以二氧化碳形式呼出。

sentences.english: He bowed and kissed our father’s hand.
sentences.chinese: 他向我鞠了一躬，转而亲吻了父王的手。

sentences.english: A bulging purse sometimes can easily turn one from knowledge learning to money pursuing.
sentences.chinese: 钱包鼓了以后，学生容易无心向学，转而向钱看。

sentences.english: That, in turn, could create a clear legal precedent for blocking unlicensed downloads.
sentences.chinese: 这样会转而为制裁非授权下载开了明确的法律先例。

sentences.english: Many countries have now shifted to reporting international traffic volumes based on point of billing.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家现在转而报告计费点的国际话务量。

sentences.english: This in turn has tarnished their reputation as the world's economic powerhouses.
sentences.chinese: 这转而玷污他们作为世界经济中心的声誉。

sentences.english: I have got the wind up about him have a car accident.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须转而驶向下风，风太大了。

sentences.english: In 1876, Homer abandoned illustration to devote himself to painting.
sentences.chinese: 1876年，霍默放弃插图工作，转而投身绘画。

definition: to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
to incline to/to prefer/to be prone to
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
to settle for second best/the next best thing
to regain/to retake/to take back/to withdraw/to revoke
